name: Buckingham Edible Woodland
description: Community project creating food for all

name: St James the Great, Syresham
description: old church with original decoration still remaining in parts.

name: Stowe Gardens
description: It's been described as 'Gardening on the grandest scale' and this Georgian landscape garden doesn't dissapoint.

name: Buckingham Canal
description: Former branch of the Grand Union Canal that is now managed for nature.

name: Buckingham Old Gaol
description: Former local clink that's now a museum.

name: sunken mauseleum
description: church with curious memorial to the local bigwigs

name: Tyringham Bridge
description: Great views of Tyringham Hall and Arched gatehouse

name: medieval tombs
description: old church with interesting tombs

name: Source of the Great Ouse
description: Pond in field which is the nominal source of the Great Ouse

name: Remains of St Peter's Church
description: Former church for the village of Stantonbury

name: Bancroft Roman Villa
description: Roman site that actually dates back to before the founding of Rome

name: Milton Keynes Museum
description: The story of Milton Keynes and what was here before - big on tranport and telephones...

name: Concrete Cows
description: what MK is most famous for - apart from roundabouts

name: Burying the hatchet
description: Comemoration of a formal burying of the hatchet at the halfway point between Oxford and Cambridge in 1935

name: Cowper and Newton Museum
description: Museum exploring the history of the creators of Amazing Grace

name: R101 Memorial
description: Fitting memorial to those who lost their lives in the R10 disaster

name: Panacea Museum
description: Vist the place where preparations were made for the end times of civilisation.

name: Silverstone Circuit
description: Home of the UK Grand Prix

name: Stony Stratford Nature Reserve
description: Thriving wetland habitas with bird hides

name: John Bunyan Museum
description: Find out more about the habitual walker and author of Pligrim's Progress

name: Cromwell Museum
description: Bijoux museum run by enthusiastic volunteers telling the story of Cromwell's life.

name: RSPB Ouse Fen
description: Former sand and gravel quarry that has become a thriving nature reserve.

name: Earith Bulwark
description: Civil War defence structure, revived in the Second World War, that is now home to rabbits.

name: Ely Museum
description: Find out how the unique location of Ely led to a unique way of life for its inhabitants.

name: Ely Cathedral
description: a.k.a Ship of the Fens, Ely Cathedral makes a big impact, especially after its 19th Century Gilbert Scott facelift.

name: Lynn Museum
description: Find out about Lynn's history including Seahenge and its trading past.

name: Bedfordshire's (l)only Windmill
description: The only remaining windmill in Bedfordshre, Stevington Windmill (technically a postmill) was used to make cattle feed.

name: St Mary's church
description: Church with intriguing medieval pew carvings and a holy well still serving people water.

name: Turvey House
description: Local manor house which is open to the public on selected days. The riverside cottage is available for rent and appeared on Mortimer and Whitehouse Gone Fishing.

name: CAMRA pub
description: The Fox Inn prides itself on its real ale and consequential CAMRA awards.

name: Harrold Odell Country Park
description: An accessible nature-rich habitat created thanks to quarrying for sand and gravel. Thereâ€™s a visitor centre, cafe and pay-by-donation car park. The bridge is also a popular place for bathers and paddlers heading towards Felmersham.

name: Willington Dovecote
description: Pretty 16th-century stone dovecote and stables

name: Houghton Mill
description: Working 18th-century watermill which is popular for paddling and has a campsite

name: Holywell
description: Pretty village with a good pub for overnighting when walking the Ouse Valley Way. As the name suggests, there's also a holy well.

name: RSPB Fen Drayton
description: Former gravel extraction site that's now a nature reserve and bird sanctuary.

name: The Norris Museum
description: 33,000 item collection started by amateur historian Herbert Norris showing a slice of Huntingdonshire.

name: A bawdy bridge
description: Bridge over the Great Ouse with its own chapel that was (for a time) a bawdy house.

name: Great Barford Bridge
description: Historic bridge over the Great Ouse that's a popular place to paddle or just picnic.

name: Prior Country Park
description: Former quarry pits now a nature habitat.

name: The matchstick woods
description: Once owned by Bryant &May - trees were grown for matchwood. Now part of the Bedford River Valley Park creating a wildlife habitat within the Great Ouse flood plain.

name: Canoe Trail
description: Hire a canoe, kayak or paddle boards. They also offer trips including to Great Barford.

name: Guru Nanak Gurdwara
description: Sikh Gurdwara serving the Sangat and wider community in Bedford

name: Roxton Congregational Church
description: Delightfully rustic non-conformist chapel.

name: Buckden Towers
description: Historic home of the bishops of Lincoln where it'spossible to stay.

name: Bradwell Abbey
description: Medieval Benedictine Priory with a dedicated pilgrimage chapel

name: Bradwell Windmill
description: Not the sort of thing you might expect to find in a brand new city, the windmill gives a sense of how old the landscape in Milton Keynes is.

name: Emmaus Village
description: Cafe and shop run by charity offering active support to people who have experienced homelessness
